str2: A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to 'chop'; specially, to beat the breast in grief.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Intrans: I lament, wail; trans: I bewail. From threnos; to bewail.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
